titles.title: Anti-Flight Act of 1993
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide punishment for fleeing Federal law enforcement personnel during the execution of their duties.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. Anti-Flight Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide that whoever, while driving a motor vehicle, knowingly and willingly flees a Federal law enforcement officer in the execution of such officer's duties shall be fined, imprisoned for up to five years, or both.
